title: REM Sleep: The Dream Stage
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on REM Sleep: The Dream Stage.

hook.text: During REM sleep, your brain is as active as when you're awakeâ€”but your body is completely paralyzed.

buildup.text: REM stands for Rapid Eye Movement. Your eyes dart behind closed lids while vivid dreams unfold.

discovery.text: REM sleep processes emotions, consolidates creative insights, and strips painful feelings from memories.

twist.text: The paralysis during REM is intentionalâ€”it prevents you from acting out your dreams and injuring yourself.

climax.text: REM deprivation causes irritability, anxiety, and difficulty with emotional regulation within just a few days.

punchline.text: Your most active sleep keeps you still and sane.

quiz.question: Why does the body become paralyzed during REM sleep?
options: To prevent you from physically acting out your dreams
Because the brain shuts down motor functions to conserve energy
Paralysis is a sign of unhealthy sleep patterns
